title: gt.geometric topology - Thomsen Blaschke condition
body: I am reading a paper (Paper 1: https://ideas.repec.org/p/cwl/cwldpp/76.html , that cites another paper ( Paper 2 ) for its proof. Paper 1, page 1, line 10 says : Consider the topological image G of a 2-dimensional convex set and 3 families of curves in that set such that a) exactly one curve of each family goes through a point of G and b)two curves of different families have at most one common point. I want to know if condition (a) means that exactly one curve of each family goes through every point of G, or if there can be points in G where no curve passes. I tried to read Paper 2 to get a better idea, but it is written in German, a language I am unable to understand. Any help will be appreciated. From what I understand, this problem is related to given 3 families of curves in a plane when is there a transformation that carries it to 3 families of parallel straight lines. The author of paper 1 calls it as Thomsen Blaschke condition, and a google search on the condition did not help me. gt.geometric-topology geometry Share Cite Improve this question Follow edited Jun 15, 2020 at 7:27 Community Bot 1 2 2 silver badges 3 3 bronze badges asked Sep 4, 2015 at 21:26 Juanito 221 1 1 silver badge 7 7 bronze badges $\endgroup$ Add a comment  |  0 Sorted by: Reset to default Highest score (default) Date modified (newest first) Date created (oldest first) You must log in to answer this question.
